Name Background: I believe my mother picked it (though obviously my father agreed) based on the movie Morgan! A Suitable Case for Treatment which had recently come out. She liked the way the name sounded in an English accent.
My aunt suggested the name Morgan- Hayes to my mother as potential girl name while she was pregnant, she liked it ultimately chose it.
Miscommunications?: No. Occasionally, I get a text from a friend or acquaintance meant for another Morgan

Name Background: My mom named me after her favorite actor (Morgan Freeman)
Miscommunications?: Yes- I had a classmate named Morgan and we would both respond to our name getting called in social situations, since it's a relatively rare name neither of us had been able to "tune it out."

Name Background: My mother picked the name - she heard it in the 70s during the era of Morgan Fairchild and always loved it for a girl.
Miscommunications?: No - my best friend from home is also named Morgan :)

Name Background: Combo of paying homage to Morgan Freeman and also they just liked the name
Miscommunications?: Yes, my freshman year of college I was receiving emails that were intended for a senior (also named Morgan Franklin).

Name Background: Both parents; They liked the name
Miscommunications?: Yes, In college there were 2 other Morgan's I was in community with. Didn't happen often but people would confuse us or say the wrong nickname from time to time

Name Background: My mom was struggling with naming me while pregnant and she was approached by what she describes as a Psychic Rastafarian at a salad bar. He was staring at her stomach and eventually said " you're going to have a girl and you're going to name her Morgana" and she decided she liked Morgan.
Miscommunications?: Nope (but I get called Megan a lot)

Name Background: My brothers named me after a character in a Disney Channel show they watched
Miscommunications?: Yes, there were a couple other Morgan's I've met through school and if we were ever in the same rooms and someone called out "Morgan", I would have to make sure they were talking about me and not the other Morgan

Name Background: My parents; they liked that it was gender-neutral, and it has slight family history
Miscommunications?: No. I only occasionally get called Megan as an accident/typo, but it has maybe happened ~10 times in my whole life.

Name Background: My parents together; I was originally supposed to be named Homan, which is a common Cantonese name, but they changed it to Morgan when they realized it meant protector of the sea, and both my parents come from cities near the coast.
Miscommunications?: Definitely not. There has not been another Morgan I've ever met who is a guy, and certainly not an Asian guy haha

Name Background: My Mother chose Morgan because she loves Morgan Freeman, and it because she said it means sea-born
My parents both agreed on it. All of my siblings (who are also all women) have gender neutral names, which is how I got to be named Morgan!
